Key Match Events: Germany advanced to the quarter-finals of Euro 2024 after an enthralling and fascinating contest against Denmark in Dortmund.
Kai Havertz converted from the penalty spot to give Germany the lead.
Jamal Musiala added a second goal with a superb curling strike.
Post-Match Reflections: Ange Postecoglou defended the refereeing decisions, particularly the penalty call.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was halted due to a thunderstorm.
Others: Germany have won three of their four games at Euro 2024, as many as in their previous 12 games across major competitions (World Cups/Euros), while 10 goals is their joint-most at a single edition of the Euros.
